document_data.name: Mount Morrowikik
document_data.mainbody: '''Mount Morrowikik''' was a mountain located in the [[Keryjek Ridge]] of the [[Great Glacier]].
document_data.Geography: Mount Morrowikik was a tall mountain, up to {{SI|10000|ft|long=yes}} in elevation. The mountain had a unique geological feature in that its peak was made of solid [[turquoise]].
document_data.Flora & Fauna: The peak of Mount Morrowikik was home to hundreds of [[white pudding]]s. There were so many that from a distance they appeared as drifting snow over the deep blue of the turquoise peak. Legend held that some white puddings grew to be as large as icebergs.
